Comment 4: 
gccgo gives compilation errors similar to gc.

gccgo accepts a uint64 argument for making a slice, and then gives a runtime error if
the value does not fit in a uintptr.

There may be two different cases to consider.  One is when the constant is known to be
too large for uint64.  The other is when the constant does not fit in an int but does
fit in an int64.  We don't necessarily have to treat those two cases in the same way.
